• Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas
Special needs education means the special educational arrangements which are in place for children with disabilities
Ciallaíonn riachtanais speisialta oideachais na socruithe speisialta oideachais atá i bhfeidhm do leanaí a bhfuil míchumas orthu
All children – including children with disabilities and children with special needs – have a constitutional right to free primary education
Tá ceart bunreachtúil ag gach leanbh – lena n-áirítear leanaí a bhfuil míchumas orthu agus leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu – bunoideachas a fháil saor in aisce
Children with special educational needs have the right to free primary education up to age 18 see ‘The law on special needs education’ below
Tá ceart ag leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu bunoideachas a fháil saor in aisce suas go dtí aois 18
In the Irish Constitution there is information about the role of the State in providing education and the rights of parents
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoin dlí faoi oideachas riachtanais speisialta le fáil i Tuilleadh mar gheall ar an ábhar seo
You are a person with special educational needs if your capacity to participate in and benefit from education is restricted due to an enduring physical, sensory, mental health or learning disability

Is duine le riachtanais speisialta oideachais thú má tá do chumas a bheith páirteach i agus tairbhe a bhaint as oideachas teoranta de dheasca a bheith faoi mhíchumais seasmhach fisiceach, céadfach, sláinte mheabhrach nó foghlama

The policy is to provide special needs education in mainstream settings as far as possible. The Education for Persons with Special Educational Needs Act 2004 (pdf) provides that children are to be educated in an inclusive setting unless this would not be in the best interests of the child or the effective provision of education for other children in mainstream education

Is é an polasaí ná oideachas riachtanas speisialta a chur ar fáil i suímh den phríomhshruth chomh fada agus is féidir.Forálann an Acht um Oideachas do Dhaoine a bhfuil Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais Orthu 2004 (pdf) go bhfuil leanaí le hoideachas a fháil i suíomh cuimsitheach mura mbeadh sé seo ar leasa an linbh nó ar leasa soláthar éifeachtach oideachais do leanaí eile in oideachas den phríomhshruth
The National Council for Special Education (NCSE) has published an information booklet for parents, Children with Special Educational Needs (pdf)
D’fhoilsíodh an Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta bileog fhaisnéise do thuismitheoirí, Leanaí a bhfuil Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais Acu (pdf)
Education for children with special needs may be provided in mainstream classes in mainstream schools, in special classes in mainstream schools or in special schools

Is féidir oideachas do leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu a chur ar fáil i ngnáthranganna i scoileanna den phríomhshruth, i ranganna speisialta i scoileanna den phríomhshruth nó i scoileanna speisialta
Many children with disabilities or special needs are in mainstream classes in mainstream schools
Tá a lán leanaí a bhuil míchumais orthu nó a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu i ngnáthranganna i scoileanna den phríomhshruth
They may get help from learning support and resource teachers and care support from special needs assistants (SNAs)
B’fhéidir go bhfaighidís cuidiú a fháil ó mhúinteoirí tacaíochta foghlama nó ó mhúinteoirí acmhainní foghlama agus ó chúntóirí riachtanas speisialta (SNAanna)
You can read more about these supports for children with special educational needs in our documents on special needs education in primary schools and post-primary schools
Tá na tacaíochtaí seo do leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu ar fáil i bunscoileanna agus iar-bhunscoileanna
Special classes in mainstream schools
Ranganna speisialta i scoileanna príomhshrutha
Some children attend special classes in mainstream schools. These classes generally have low pupil/teacher ratios. Special schools
Freastalaíonn roinnt leanaí ar ranganna speisialta i scoileanna den phríomhshruth
There are over 140 special schools catering for particular types of disability and special needs
De ghnáth bíonn cóimheasanna ísle múinteoir le daltaí sna ranganna seo
You can find the special schools in your area on the website of the Department of Education and Skills
Tá scoileanna speisialta ar suíomh gréasáin na Ranna Oideachais agus Scileanna
Special arrangements for particular disabilities
Socruithe speisialta do mhíchumais ar leith
Students with specific leaning disabilities may be able to get an exemption from some of the usual educational requirements
Is féidir le daltaí a bhfuil míchumais sainiúla foghlama a bheith in ann díolúine a fháil ó chuid de na gnáthriachtanais oideachais
For example, if you have dyslexia you may be exempt from the requirement to study Irish and/or a continental language
Mar shampla, má tá disléices ort b’fhéidir go mbeifeá díolmhaithe ó riachtanas staidéar a dhéanamh ar an nGaeilge agus/nó teanga ón mhór-roinn
Under the Education for Persons with Special Educational Needs Act 2004 (the EPSEN Act) each child assessed with a special educational need should have a personal education plan

Faoin Acht um Oideachas do Dhaoine a bhfuil Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais acu 2004 ba cheart go mbeadh plean pearsanta oideachais ag gach leanbh a meastar go bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu

This system is not yet in place but its implementation is being coordinated by the National Council for Special Education (NCSE) which has published Guidelines for the Individual Education Plan process (pdf)

Níl an córas seo ag feidhmiú fós ach tá a chur i bhfeidhm á chomhordú ag an gComhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta (CNOS) a d’fhoilsigh Treoirlínte do Phróiseas an Phlean Aonair Oideachais (pdf)
The NCSE has also published Implementation Report: Plan for the Phased Implementation of the EPSEN Act 2004
D’fhoilsigh an CNOS Tuarascáil ar Chur i bhFeidhm: Plean le hAghaidh Cur i bhFeidhm Céimithe an Achta EPSEN 2004 chomh maith
This sets out how the Act can be implemented
Leagann sé seo amach an dóigh ar féidir an tAcht a chur i bhfeidhm
However there is currently no date for the implementation of the assessment of need and individual education plans
Áfach níl aon dáta faoi láthair (2009) an measúnú ar riachtanais agus plean pearsanta oideachais á chur i bhfeidhm
Special transport arrangements, including escorts and safety harnesses are available for children with disabilities attending school
Tá Socruithe speisialta iompair, lena n-áirítear coimhdirí agus úmacha slándála ar fáil do leanaí a bhfuil míchumais orthu atá ag freastal ar scoil
Organisations and statutory bodies with a role in special needs education
Eagraíochtaí agus comhlachtaí reachtúla a bhfuil ról acu san oideachas riachtanas speisialta
The National Council for Special Education
An Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta
The National Council for Special Education (NCSE) is a statutory body with particular functions in relation to special needs education
Is comhlacht reachtúil é an Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta a bhfuil feidhmeanna áirithe aige maidir le hoideachas riachtanais speisialta
Its main functions are:
Is iad seo a phríomhfheidhmeanna:
• Planning and co-ordinating the provision of education and support services to children with special educational needs (in conjunction with schools and the Health Service Executive (HSE)

• Soláthar seirbhísí oideachais agus tacaíochta do leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu a phleanáil agus a chomhordú (i gcomhar le scoileanna agus leis an bhFeidhmeannacht Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS)
• Planning the implementation of the Education for Persons with Special Needs Act – see above
• Cur i bhfeidhm an Achta um Oideachas do Dhaoine a bhfuil Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais acu a phleanáil
• Disseminating information on best practice concerning the education of children with special educational needs
• Faisnéis a scaipeadh maidir leis an gcleachtas is fearr maidir le hoideachas leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu
• Providing information to parents in relation to the entitlements of children with special educational needs
• Faisnéis a chur ar fáil do thuismitheoirí maidir le teidlíochtaí leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu
• Assessing and reviewing resources required by children with special educational needs
• Measúnú agus athbhreithniú a dhéanamh ar acmhainní atá de dhíth ar leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu
• Ensuring that progress of students with special educational needs is monitored and reviewed
• Cinntiú go ndéantar monatóireacht agus athbhreithniú ar dhul chun cinn mac léinn a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu
• Reviewing education provision for adults with disabilities
• Athbhreithniú a dhéanamh ar sholáthar oideachais d’aosaigh a bhfuil míchumais orthu
• Advising educational institutions on best practice
• Institiúidí oideachais a chomhairliú maidir leis an gcleachtas is fear
• Consulting with voluntary bodies
• Comhairliú le comhlachtaí deonacha
• Advising the Minister for Education and Skills on matters relating to special education
• Comhairle a thabhairt don Aire Oideachais agus Scileanna ar rudaí a bhaineann leis an oideachas speisialta
• Conducting research and publishing findings
• Taighde a dhéanamh agus torthaí a fhoilsiú
Special Educational Needs Organisers
Eagarthóirí Riachanais Speisialta Oideachais

The NCSE employs over 80 Special Educational Needs Organisers (SENOs) who are responsible for allocating additional teaching and other resources to support the special educational needs of children with disabilities at local level

Fostaíonn an CNOS breis agus 80 Eagraitheoirí Riachtanas Speisialta Oideachais (SENOanna) atá freagrach as teagasc breise agus acmhainní eile a dháileadh chun tacaíocht a thabhairt do riachtanais oideachais speisialta leanaí a bhfuil míchumais orthu ar leibhéal áitiúil
SENOs are the point of contact for parents/guardians and schools
Is iad na SENOanna an pointe teagmhála do thuismitheoirí/ghairdiain agus scoileanna
Their main activities are:
Is iad seo a leanas na príomhghníomhaíochtaí atá acu:

• Processing applications from all schools for resource teacher support in respect of children with low-incidence disabilities such as moderate general learning disabilities, visual or hearing impairments, physical disabilities or autism, and deciding on the level of support appropriate to the school

• Iarratais ó gach scoil a phróiseáil maidir le tacaíocht múinteoirí acmhainne maidir le leanaí a bhfuil míchumais íosmhinicíochta orthu amhail míchumais mheasartha ghinearálta foghlama, laigí radhairc nó éisteachta, míchumais fhisiceacha nó uathachas, agus ag cinneadh ar leibhéal na tacaíochta atá fóirsteanach don scoil

• Processing applications from second-level schools for resource teacher support in respect of children with high-incidence disabilities such as mild general learning disability and deciding on the level of support appropriate to the school

• Iarratais a phróiseáil ó scoileanna dara leibhéal do thacaíocht mhúinteora acmhainní maidir le leanaí le míchumais ardmhinicíochta amhail mion-mhíchumas ginearálta foghlama agus ag cinneadh ar leibhéal na tacaíochta atá fóirsteanach don scoil
• Processing applications from schools and deciding on the appropriate level of special needs assistant support for children with disabilities
• Iarratais ó scoileanna a phróiseáil agus leibhéal cuí na tacaíochta ó chúntóir riachtanas speisialta a chinneadh do leanaí a bhfuil míchumais orthu
• Examining applications from all schools for special equipment/assistive technology (decisions on this are made by the Department of Education and Skills)
• Iarratais ar threalamh speisialta/teicneolaíocht cúnaimh a scrúdú ó na scoileanna go léir (is í an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna a dhéanann cinntí faoi seo)
• Examining applications from schools for transport arrangements for children with disabilities and making recommendations to the Department of Education and Skills
• Iarratais ó scoileanna ar shocruithe iompair do leanaí a bhfuil míchumais orthu a scrúdú agus moltaí a dhéanamh leis an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna
• Identifying the appropriate educational setting for individual children with special educational needs
• Ag aithint an tsuímh oideachais atá oiriúnach do leanaí aonair a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu
SENOs also provide advice and support for parents of children with special educational needs
Tá liosta SENOanna ar fáil ar shuíomh gréasáin na Comhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta
The National Council for Curriculum and Assessment
An Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Churaclam agus Mheasúnú
The National Council for Curriculum and Assessment (NCCA) is a statutory body
Is comhlacht reachtúil é an Chomhairle Náisiúnta Curaclaim agus Mheasúnachta (CNCM)
One of its functions is to advise the Minister for Education and Skills on the curriculum and syllabus requirements of students with disabilities or with special educational needs

Ceann de na feidhmeanna atá aici ná comhairle a thabhairt don Aire Oideachais agus Scileanna ar an gcuraclam agus riachtanais siollabais mac léinn a bhfuil míchumais orthu nó riachtanais speisialta acu
The Council has published Guidelines for Teachers of Students with General Learning Disabilities
Tá Tá Treoirlínte do Mhúinteoirí Daltaí a bhfuil Míchumais Ghinearálta Foghlama orthu foilsithe ag an gComhairle
The NCCA has also produced draft guidelines for teachers of exceptionally able students
Chomh maith leis sin tá an CNCM ag forbairt treoirlínte faoi láthair do mhúinteoirí a bhfuil mic léinn atá thar a bheith cumasach acu
The Special Education Support Service (SESS)
Seirbhís Tacaíochta don Oideachas Speisialta
The Special Education Support Service (SESS) was established to manage, co-ordinate and develop a range of supports in response to the identified training needs of teachers

Bhunaigh an Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna an tSeirbhís Tacaíochta don Oideachas Speisialta (STOS) le réimse tacaíochtaí a bhainistiú, a chomhordú agus a fhorbairt mar fhreagairt ar riachtanais oiliúna aitheanta na múinteoirí
The SESS, which is hosted in Cork Education Centre, provides a nationwide service to teachers and special needs assistants
Cuireann an STOS, atá óstaithe in Ionad Oideachais Chorcaí, seirbhís ar fáil ar fud na tíre do mhúinteoirí agus do chúntóirí riachtanas speisialta
The aim of the service is to enhance the quality of teaching and learning with particular reference to the education of children with special needs
Is í aidhm na seirbhíse ná cáilíocht an teagaisc agus na foghlama a fheabhsú go háirithe i dtaca le hoideachas leanaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu
The National Educational Psychological Service (NEPS)
Seirbhís Náisiúnta Síceolaíochta Oideachais
The National Educational Psychological Service (NEPS) is an executive agency of the Department of Education and Skills
Is gníomhaireacht fheidhmeannach den Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna í an tSeirbhís Náisiúnta Síceolaíochta Oideachais (SNSO)
NEPS provides psychological services to primary and post-primary schools, both state and private
Cuireann SNSO seirbhísí síceolaíochta ar fáil do bhunscoileanna agus d’iar-bhunscoileanna, idir scoileanna stáit agus scoileanna príobháideacha
NEPS processes applications for 'reasonable accommodation' in the State examination arrangements for children with disabilities
Próiseálann SNSO iarratais ar “chóiríocht réasúnach” sna socruithe le haghaidh scrúduithe stáit do leanaí a bhfuil míchumais orthu
Department of Education and Skills
An Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna
National Council for Special Education
An Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta
There have been significant legal changes in recent years concerning special needs education
Oideachas riachtanas speisialta - an dlí
These changes affect the rights of children with disabilities and other children who suffer educational disadvantage for whatever reason
Tháinig athruithe suntasacha ar an dlí le blianta beaga anuas a bhfuil tionchar acu ar pháistí le míchumas nó ar pháistí atá faoi mhíbhuntáiste oideachais ar chúis ar bith
Special needs education means the special education arrangements in place for children with disabilities
Déanann oideachas speisialta cur síos ar na socruithe oideachais atá ann do pháistí le míchumas
Measures to address educational disadvantage describes the supports provided for educationally disadvantaged children
Déanann beartaíocht chun dul i ngleic le míbhuntáiste oideachais cur síos ar cén chaoi a dtéitear i ngleic go praicticiúil leis na cearta dleathúla atá ag páistí faoi mhíbhuntáiste
Education for Persons with Special Educational Needs Act 2004
An tAcht um Oideachas do Dhaoine le Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais 2004
The Education for Persons with Special Educational Needs Act 2004 (pdf) provides for the education of children aged under 18 years with special educational needs
Forálann an tAcht um Oideachas do Dhaoine le Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais 2004 go gcuirtear oideachas ar dhaoine óga faoi bhun 18 le riachtanais speisialta oideachais
The Act focuses on children’s education but there are references to further and adult education
Leagtar béim san Acht ar oideachas leanaí ach tá tagairtí ann freisin do bhreisoideachas agus d’oideachas aosach

You are a person with special educational needs if your capacity to participate in and benefit from education is restricted due to an enduring physical, sensory, mental health or learning disability. While the Act is passed, all parts of it are not fully in effect

Áirítear tú mar dhuine le riachtanais speisialta oideachais mura bhfuil sé ar do chumas bheith páirteach go hiomlán in oideachas agus tairbhe a bhaint as mar gheall ar mhíchumas buan, bíodh sé fisiceach, céadfach, meabhairshláinteach nó foghlamtha
• Provides that people with special educational needs are educated in an inclusive environment, as far as possible
• Forálann sé go gcuirtear oideachas ar dhaoine le riachtanais speisialta oideachais i dtimpeallacht chuimsitheach, chomh fada agus is féidir
• Establishes that people with special educational needs have the same right to avail of and benefit from education as children who do not have those needs
• Dearbhaíonn sé go bhfuil na cearta céanna ag daoine le riachtanais speisialta oideachais páirt a ghlacadh in oideachas agus tairbhe a bhaint as agus atá ag daoine nach bhfuil na riachtanais sin acu
• Provides for the greater involvement of parents in the education of their children and decision making
• Forálann sé do bhreis rannpháirtíochta ag tuismitheoirí in oideachas a leanaí agus i gcinnteoireacht
• Establishes the National Council for Special Education (NCSE) on a statutory basis
• Bunaíonn sé an Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta (CNOS) ar bhonn reachtúil
• Gives statutory functions to the Health Service Executive with regard to the education of people with special educational needs
• Tugann sé feidhmeanna reachtúla do bhoird sláinte (dá ngairtear Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte) maidir le hoideachas daoine le riachtanais speisialta oideachais
• Establishes an independent appeals system – the Special Education Appeals Board – where decisions made about the education of people with special educational needs can be appealed

• Bunaíonn sé córas neamhspleách achomhairc - an Bord Achomhairc um Oideachas Speisialta - le go bhféadfaí achomharc a dhéanamh in aghaidh cinntí maidir le socraithe oideachais do dhaoine le riachtanais speisialta oideachais
The Act sets out a range of services to be provided to people with special educational needs
Ordaítear san Acht réimse seirbhísí le cur ar fáil do dhaoine le riachtanais speisialta oideachais
These include assessments, education plans and other support services
Orthu sin tá measúnachtaí, pleananna oideachais agus seirbhísí tacaíochta eile
Parents can seek assessments of a child’s educational needs
Féadfaidh tuismitheoirí measúnacht a iarraidh ar riachtanais speisialta a bpáistí
Assessments can be initiated by the Health Service Executive (HSE), by a school principal or by the National Council for Special Education
Féadfaidh Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS), príomhoide scoile nó an Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta measúnachtaí a thionscnamh
The system for personal education plans is not yet in place and its implementation is being co-ordinated by the NCSE
Níl an córas pleananna pearsanta oideachais ann fós. Tá an FSS ag comhordú an cur i gníomh
The HSE is currently responsible for providing health services to pre-school children and may provide speech and language therapy services
Is í an Chomhairle Náisiúnta um Oideachas Speisialta (NCSE) a bheidh freagrach as seirbhísí a chur ar fáil do leanaí scoile
The NCSE will be responsible for providing services to school-going children
Cuireann an NCSE acmhainní breise múinteoireachta agus eile ar fáil le tacú le riachtanais oideachais speisialta leanaí faoi mhíchumas
The Special Education Appeals Board and mediation
Is iad seo a leanas feidhmeanna na Comhairle:
The 2004 Act provides for alternative methods of dispute resolution and encourages a move away from the courts as the forum for redress
• Pleanáil le haghaidh cur i bhfeidhm Acht um Oideachas do Dhaoine a bhfuil Riachtanais Speisialta Oideachais Acu 2004
The Special Education Appeals Board was established in 2006 for the resolution of disputes and the determination of appeals and the first Board members were appointed
• Monatóireacht a dhéanamh ar dhul chun cinn daltaí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu agus athbhreithniú a dhéanamh ar na hacmhainní atá riachtanach sa réimse seo
When the Appeals Board comes into operation, the Act provides for the following:
An Bord Achomhairc um Oideachas Speisialta agus idirghabháil
• If the council refuses to arrange an assessment of a child or to prepare an education plan, the parents of the child or the school principal may appeal to the Appeals Board
Bunaíodh an Bord Achomhairc um Oideachas Speisialta i 2006 chun díospóidí a réiteach agus chun cinntí a dhéanamh faoi achomhairc, agus tá chéad bhaill an Bhoird ceaptha cheana féin
• The Appeals Board will have the power to direct the council to arrange the preparation of an assessment or of an education plan
Tá sé de chumhacht ag an mBord Achomhairc ordú a thabhairt don chomhairle socruithe a dhéanamh chun an leanbh a mheas nó plean oideachais a cheapadh
In this case, the council must comply with the direction of the Appeals Board
Ní mór don chomhairle géilleadh do threoir an Bhoird sa chás sin
• The Appeals Board may dismiss the appeal of the parents or principal
Féadfaidh an Bord diúltú d’achomharc na dtuismitheoirí nó an phríomhoide
The 2004 Act also provides for a process of mediation following the exhaustion of any rights of appeal under the legislation
Tá foráil in Acht na bliana 2004 go mbeadh próiseas idirghabhála ann má ídítear aon cheart achomhairc atá ann faoin reachtaíocht
The Education Act 1998
An tAcht Oideachais 1998
The Education Act 1998 deals with education generally but emphasises the rights of children with disabilities and with other special educational needs
Cuireann an tAcht Oideachais 1998 béim ar na cearta atá ag páistí le míchumas agus le riachtanais speisialta oideachais
This Act is in effect and provides that every person concerned with the implementation of the legislation must have regard to a number of objectives including:
Leagann sé síos go gcaithfidh gach duine atá ag plé le cur i bhfeidhm na rachtaíochta, aird a thabhairt ar roinnt cuspóirí, ina measc:
• To give practical effect to the constitutional rights of children including children who have a disability or who have other special educational needs, as they relate to education

• Go gcuirfí i bhfeidhm go praicticiúil ó thaobh an oideachais na cearta bunreachtúla atá ag páistí, ag cur san áireamh páistí a bhfuil míchumas orthu nó a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta oideachais acu
• To provide that, as far as is practicable and having regard to the resources available, a level and quality of education appropriate to the needs and abilities of the people of the country

• Go gcuirfí ar fáil, chomh fada agus is féidir go praicticiúil agus ag cuimhniú ar na hachmhainní atá ann, oideachas den chaighdeán agus den chineál atá in oiriúint do riachtanais agus do chumas mhuintir na tíre

The Minister for Education and Skills is obliged, among other things, to ensure that everyone living in Ireland (including people with disabilities and people who have other special educational needs) has available support services and a level and quality of education appropriate to his/her needs and abilities

Tá dualgas ar an Aire Oideachais agus Scileanna, i measc rudaí eile, a chinntiú go bhfuil fáil ag gach duine atá ag cónaí sa stát, daoine le míchumais agus le riachtanais speisialta eile oideachais san áireamh, ar sheirbhísí tacaíochta agus ar oideachas atá ar an gcaighdeán agus ar an gcineál atá oiriúnach dá riachtanais agus dá (h)éirim
The 1998 Act gives the Minister for Education and Skills certain functions in respect of funding, including the funding of support services for students with disabilities
Cuireann an tAcht dualgais áirithe ar an Aire Oideachais agus Scileanna i leith airgeadú, ina measc airgeadú na seirbhísí tacaíochta do scoláirí le míchumais, ina measc
Schools must use their available resources to ensure that the educational needs of all students, including those with disabilities, are identified and provided for

Cuireann sé de dhualgas ar scoileanna freisin a gcuid achmhainní a úsáid d'fhonn a chinntiú go n-aithnítear agus go ndéantar soláthar do na riachtanais oideachais atá ag na daltaí go léir iad siúd le mí chumais ina measc

Boards of Management are required to use the State resources provided to the school to make reasonable provisions and accommodation for students with disabilities or other special education needs, including, where necessary, alteration of buildings and the provision of appropriate equipment

Cuireann sé de dhualgas ar an mBord Bainistíochta úsáid a bhaint as airgead a tháinig ón Stát, chun soláthar agus socrú reasúnta a dhéanamh do scoláirí le míchumas nó le riachtanais oideachais speisialta eile. I measc na socraithe seo bheadh, nuair ba ghá, athruithe le déanamh ar fhoirgnimh agus treallamh oiriúnach a chur ar fáil
The Act also provides that the criteria for funding of schools may allow for the payment of additional grants to schools, having regard to the level of educational disadvantage
De réir an Achta freisin, d'fhéadfadh na slait tomhais le haghaidh airgeadú scoileanna, deontaisí breise a cheadú do scoileanna ag braith ar cén leibhéal míbhuntaiste oideachais atá i gceist
The 1998 Act defines support services as including, among other things:
Sé an sainmhíniú atá ag an Acht ar sheirbhísí tacaíochta ná ( i measc gnéithe eile ):
• Guidance and counselling services
• Seirbhísí Chomhairleacha agus Threoracha
• Technical aids and equipment, including means of access to schools, adaptations to buildings to facilitate access and transport for students with special needs and their families

• Fearas agus Áiseanna theicniúla, ina measc bealach isteach chuig scoileanna, athrú ar fhoirgnimh chun bealach isteach a réiteach, agus córas taistil do dhaltaí le riachtanais speisialta agus dá gcuid teaghlaigh
• Provision for students learning through Irish sign language or other sign language, including interpreting services
• Áiseanna do dhaltaí atá ag foghlaim tré mhéan teanga chomhartha na hÉireann nó teanga chomhartha eile agus seirbhísí teangaireachta ina measc
• Provision for early childhood, primary, post-primary, adult or continuing education to students with special needs otherwise than in schools or centres for education
• Áiseanna le haghaidh luathoideachas, oideachas bunscoile, iarbhunscoile agus aosach nó leanúnach do dhaltaí le riachtanais speisialta taobh amuigh de scoileanna nó de ionaid oideachais
The Equal Status Acts 2000-2011
Na hAchtanna Ionannais Stádais 2000-2011
The Equal Status Act 2000-2011, outlaws discrimination in areas of life - mainly the provision of services
Eisreachtaíonn na hAchtanna um Stádas Comhionann 2000 - 2011 an t-idirdhealú i réimsí saoil lasmuigh den obair - go háirithe i soláthar seirbhísí
The Acts apply to educational services, including private schools and pre-school facilities
Baineann na nAchtanna le seirbhísí oideachais - scoileanna príobháideacha agus áiseanna réamhscoile san áireamh
There are certain specific provisions in the Acts in relation to education and some of these deal with people with disabilities or people who have special needs
Tá coinníollacha ar leith san Acht maidir le hoideachas agus baineann cuid acu sin le daoine le míchumas nó daoine a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu
The Equal Status Acts outlaw direct and indirect discrimination on a number of grounds including gender, religion, disability, race and membership of the Traveller community
Coscann na nAchtanna idirdhealú díreach agus indíreach ar bhunúis éagsúla, ina measc gnéas, reiligiún, míchumas, cine agus ballríocht den lucht taistil
Under the law, a school may not discriminate in relation to:
Faoin Acht ní féidir le scoil idirdhealú a dhéanamh ar bhunús:
• The admission or the terms and conditions of admission of a student
• Cead isteach nó na tearmaí agus na coinníollacha a bhaineann leis an gcead isteach
• The access of a student to any course, facility or benefit provided
• Bealach isteach an scoláire chuig aon chúrsa, áis nó sochar atá curtha ar fáil
• Any other term or condition of participation in the school by the student
• Aon téarma nó coinníoll eile a bhainfeadh le rannpháirtíocht an scoláire sa scoil
• The expulsion of a student or any other sanction
• Díbirt an scoláire nó aon phionós eile
Discrimination on grounds of disability
Idirdhealú ar bhunú míchumais
The Equal Status Acts set out certain activities that do not constitute discrimination
Leagann an nAchtanna um Stádas Comhionann síos imeachtaí áirithe nach údar idirdhealaithe iad
The following relate to discrimination on the grounds of disability:
Baineann siad seo a leanas le idirdhealú ar bhunús míchumais:
• Schools may make different arrangements for sport for children on the basis of age, gender or disability if these are reasonably necessary
• Is féidir le scoileanna socruithe ar leith a dhéanamh le haghaidh spóirt do pháistí ar bhunús aoise, gnéis nó míchumais má tá gá ciallmhar leo

• Schools will not be considered to discriminate against a student with a disability if compliance with the provisions of the legislation would have a seriously detrimental effect on or make impossible the provision of services to other students

• Ní bheidh idirdhealú déanta ag scoil i gcoinne dalta le míchumas má chiallaíonn claoí leis an Acht go mbeadh droch thioncar aige ar dhaltaí eile nó go mbeadh sé dodhéanta seirbhísí a chur ar fáil dóibh
• In certain circumstances, discrimination on the grounds of disability can occur if there is a failure to do all that is reasonable to accommodate the needs of a person with a disability
• I gcásanna áirithe, is féidir le idirdhealú ar bhunús míchumais tarlú mura mbíonn gach iarracht réasúnta déanta rudaí a chur in oiriúint do dhuine le míchumas

If a person with a disability cannot avail of a service without the provision of special treatment or facilities then the service provider may be required to provide such special arrangements if there is only a nominal cost involved

Munar féidir le duine míchumasach úsáid a bhaint as seirbhís gan cóireáil nó áiseanna speisialta a bheith curtha ar fáil, ansin d'fhéadfaí iarradh ar an té atá ag cur na seirbhísí ar fáil na socruithe speisialta seo a dhéanamh mura bhfuil ach costas ainmneach i gceist
• The Act includes a provision that clarifies that the nominal cost issue does not prejudice or dilute the various provisions in the Education Act 1998 in relation to children with a disability

• Tá coinníoll san Acht a dhéanann soiléiriú ar "chostas ainmneach", sé sin nach bhfuil an costas / ainmneacha díobhálach do, agus nach ndéanann siad maolú ar, na gnéithe éagsúla atá san Acht Oideachais 1998 maidir le páistí le míchumais
It should be noted that these provisions all relate to the use of public funds
Ba cheart a thuiscint go mbaineann na rialacha seo ar fad le úsáid airgead poiblí
This means that private primary schools are only obliged to make special provision for children with disabilities if there is only a nominal cost involved
Ciallaíonn sé seo nach bhfuil gá do scoileanna príobháideacha socruithe speisialta a dhéanamh do pháistí le míchumais ach amháin sa chás agus nach bhfuil ach costas ainmneach i gceist
